thread.title: Wowryk paces Terriers to eighth straight win
thread.title_full: Wowryk paces Terriers to eighth straight win

title: Wowryk paces Terriers to eighth straight win
text:
Wowryk paces Terriers to eighth straight win By: Uncredited 
Adam Wowryk scored a pair of goals, including an empty-netter, as the Portage Terriers won their eighth straight Manitoba Junior Hockey League game on Sunday. 
Turner Santin netted the other marker in the Terriers’ 3-0 victory in Virden. 
Nathan Park stopped 17 shots for his fifth shutout of the season for Portage (12-1-0). Sean Kuehn made 33 saves for Virden (6-6-0). 
In Saturday’s games, it was: Winkler Flyers 3, Oil Capitals 2; Steinbach Pistons 5, Dauphin Kings 3; and Winnipeg Blues 6, Waywayseecappo Wolverines 0. 
Flyers 3 Oil Capitals 2 
On Saturday at Virden, Dionne Demke’s third-period marker stood up as the game-winner for the Flyers (10-3-1), who also got goals from Tristan Keck and Nolan McGuire. Mack Hardy and Bennett Dalke replied for the Oil Caps. 
Pistons 5 Kings 3 
At Dauphin, Quintin Lisoway, who’s from Neepawa, netted a hat trick and set up another goal for the Pistons (9-4-0). Kirklan Lycar scored twice and Drake Bodie added a single for the Kings (6-6-0), with Kyle Bird assisting on each marker. 
Blues 6 Wolverines 0 
At Waywayseecappo, Liam Kroeker, Ryan Pruden and Mitch Hansen all had a goal and an assist for the Blues (6-5-3), while Scott Parsons made 28 saves for his first shutout of the year. Greg Harney stopped 30 shots for the Wolverines (3-8-2).
